title.narrative: Responding to displacement-induced needs of women and men, boys and girls in four hard to reach Districts in Ghazni province through emergency Shelter Upgrade Kits and Non Food Item (NFI) distribution.

description.narrative: The proposed project will address the spike in needs caused by shock-induced displacement in Ghazni province, a part of Afghanistan that is often overlooked due to restricted access. Ghazni has historically been one of the more volatile provinces in the country and has witnessed a decrease in security over the past year, causing the number of internally displaced people (IDPs) currently living in Gelan, Ghazni, Qarabagh and Muqur districts in particular to increase rapidly. In addition to the trauma of displacement, needs in these areas are further compounded by three main factors: shock-induced poverty (that adds to precarious economic situations pre-shock) limited availability of resources and a lack of services in the area of destination. Recent multi-sectoral assessments conducted by RI (Annexes 1-3) have highlighted ACCESS TO SHELTER AND NON FOOD ITEMS (NFIs) as key priorities, along with health, WASH and protection. Shelter and NFIs are almost entirely overlooked by humanitarian actors in the target areas, despite the urgent need amidst the winter and upcoming rainy season. The proposed project therefore aims to provide life-saving interventions by targeting 710 households (4970 indiviuals) identified as the most vulnerable and in need of immediate humanitarian assistance. Within this caseload, we estimate that 539 households (3773 indivuduals) will require shelter upgrade kits, and 171 households (1197 individuals) will require NFIs. To ensure beneficiaries are able to upgrade their shelter effectively, RI will deliver training on how to use the kits upon receipt. By delivering these services, RI’s project will contribute towards strategic priorities identified by the ESNFI Cluster, OCHA and the Government of Islamic Republic of Afghanistan (GoIRA). These include i) responding to immediate humanitarian needs of shock affected populations ii) reducing protracted displacement-induced vulnerabilities and iii) improving conditions for conflict and displacement affected communities in hard to reach areas. In this way, the project responds directly to the ESNFI Cluster Objective to ensure coordinated and timely ES/NFI response to families affected by natural disaster and armed conflict. It also responds to the following two objectives: SO 1: Save lives in the areas of highest need SO 3: People struck by sudden onset crises get the help they need, on time Project design and implementation has been informed by: multi-sector needs assessments (February and August 2017) in depth sector assessments in Shelter/NFIs, GBV and Health, conducted in December 2017 and a multisector assessment conducted in December 2017 in the target area, to ensure maximum relevance and accuracy. Beneficiary selection will be determined using a HEAT form.
